result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David C Stahl

defendant.name: Stahl, David C
defendant.address: 3900 W Brown Deer Rd #219, Milwaukee, WI 53209

records.addlTxt: to be done outpatient, signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr November 3, 2022.
Review hearing on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:06 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant David C Stahl not in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for David C Stahl.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Herbers advises he has been in contact with his client and is not able to appear today due to some mental health treatment.  Based on that information Atty. Herbers raises issues of competency. 
 DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days, but noting that the defendant is anticipated to be placed in a mental health treatment facility very soon.  Atty. Herbers advises he can reach out to the doctor to advise them where the defendant is located for the competency evaluation.  Court will adjourn for review hearing.  Court also notes there was a WCS non-compliance letter and will address that at the next court date as well.
Review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 11/1/22 received and filed.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10/13/22 received and filed.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly - WCS report will be addressed at next court date**
Hearing on November 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:18 AM Defendant David C Stahl in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for David C Stahl.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

The Court addresses the WCS non-compliance letter.
The Court notes that WCS did file a partial compliance letter on 09/13/2022.
Attorney Herbers presents statements that the Defendant just found employment and will hopefully have a paycheck by this Friday to pay the outstanding balance of SCRAM.
ADA Will does not object to the Defendant removing the SCRAM at this time.
The Court will not order SCRAM to be put back in place.
The Court will take no further action at this time.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service partial compliance letter received and filed.

request to adjourn Prelim **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 9/8 "Denied. Mr. Stahl needs to appear in person to account for the recent WCS report. A new request may be made upon a positive report."
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 8/29/22 received and filed.  **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 8/30/22 "Will be addressed at court."
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.

02:56 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant David C Stahl in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Court will set this matter for preliminary hearing before the Court Commissioner and will tag 22CM1193 along with for status.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Filed by Atty. Herbers.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Herbers as counsel of record for the defendant.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Laura Lau July 18, 2022.
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

01:36 PM Defendant David C Stahl in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
WCS Pre-trial Report
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
